definition: to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao
sprout
to help/to assist
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
length/long/forever/always/constantly

sentences.english: To educate the young generation in such a way is just like making the rice shoots grow by pulling them up.
sentences.chinese: 用這種方法教育下一代無異於拔苗助長。

sentences.english: Let your ideas cook in May, and don't rush the process by calling or adding subtle pressure.
sentences.chinese: 讓你的好主意在5月萌芽，不要施加壓力拔苗助長。

sentences.english: Teaching children in this way simply means applying too much pressure and damaging them.
sentences.chinese: 用這種方法教育孩子，簡直是拔苗助長。

sentences.english: Grass grows in its own time but if you keep pulling it, it will just die.
sentences.chinese: 草會自己生長，如果拔苗助長，它便會死去。

sentences.english: But it's important not to rush things to avoid setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止復發，拔苗助長是絕對不可以的。

sentences.english: I believe he has the talent – the problem is not to hurry him too much.
sentences.chinese: 我相信他有能力，問題是不要拔苗助長。

definition: to nip in the bud (idiom)
courage/bravery
superstructure
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
druggist
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to play deaf-mute
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: prosperous and developing/flourishing
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
